title: GROUP TWO
text:
Welcome and thanks for taking the time to check out our STATs final. During this project, we investigate financial predictors of U.S. tax-exempt organizations. Below is some additional information about the two members of Group Two. We hope you enjoy reading!


Anand Boldbaatar



Anand Boldbaatar


I am Anand Boldbaatar a masters student at George Mason university, majoring In Applied data analytics. My undergrad was in IT (Database and programming)


Veronica Wood



Veronica Wood


My name is Veronica Wood. I earned a B.S. in Business Management from Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) in 2019, and I’m excited to learn more with a MS in Data Analytics Engineering program.
I have always been interested by the stories that data can tell and how those insights can drive meaningful improvement. My interest grew further during my role as a Budget Analyst for the Department of Defense, where I provide analysis across multiple financial portfolios.
I believe that pursuing the MS DAEN degree will provide me with a more well-rounded foundation in data analysis and position me for continued growth in the field.

title: FINAL CODE
text:
eo.pr <- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo_pr.csv')
eo.xx <- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo_xx.csv')
eo1<- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo1 (1).csv')
eo2 <- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo2.csv')
eo3 <- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo3.csv')
eo4 <- read.csv('/Users/veronicawood/School/GM Fall 2025 /STAT 515 - Applied Statistics and Visualization for Analytics/Final project/eo4.csv')

library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

big_df <- bind_rows(eo.pr, eo.xx, eo1, eo2, eo3, eo4)

tax.all <- big_df %>%
  filter(!is.na(INCOME_AMT),
         INCOME_AMT > 0)


states_50 <- state.abb

tax.all <- tax.all %>%
  filter(STATE %in% states_50)

tax.all$TaxDate <- as.Date(
  paste0(tax.all$TAX_PERIOD, "01"),  
  format = "%Y%m%d")

cutoff <- as.Date("2021-01-01")

tax.all <- tax.all %>%
  filter(TaxDate >= cutoff)

table(floor(tax.all$TAX_PERIOD / 100))


  2021   2022   2023   2024   2025 
  2000  12588 163787 449185  39414 

tax.2024 <- tax.all %>%
  filter(floor(TAX_PERIOD / 100) == 2024)

title: PROJECT ANALYSIS
text:
Queation 1

Which organizational characteristics most strongly predict whether a nonprofit is high-revenue?
To determine how factors such as mission type (NTEE major group), organizational structure (group-affiliated vs standalone), geography (state), financial attributes (assets, revenue), and fiscal year-end month contribute to predicting whether a nonprofit has income above the median for the year 2024.
•   Logistic Regression
•   Decision Trees
•   Random Forest
•   KNN

title: PROJECT ANALYSIS
text:
Queation 2
####To what extent does geography (state-level location) influence whether a nonprofit is high-revenue?
Test whether revenue patterns vary significantly by state and whether geography is a meaningful predictor after controlling for other factors.
•   Logistic Regression
•   Decision Tree
•   Random Forest

title: PROJECT ANALYSIS
text:
Queation 3

Does mission type (NTEE major group) significantly influence whether a nonprofit is high-revenue?
Focus on how mission category (Arts, Education, Health, Human Services, Religion, etc.) contributes to financial performance.
•   Logistic Regression
•   Tree / Random Forest
•   KNN (optional)

title: PROJECT ANALYSIS
text:
Queation 4

Do group-affiliated nonprofits differ from standalone nonprofits in their likelihood of being high-revenue?
Examine whether belonging to a parent organization (group ruling) affects financial capacity
•   Logistic Regression
•   Decision Tree
•   Random Forest<br>

title: PROJECT ANALYSIS
text:
Queation 5

Can a nonprofit’s mission type (NTEE major group) be predicted using its financial indicators and organizational attributes?
Flip the previous questions: instead of predicting income from mission, predict mission from financial structure.
•   Multinomial Logistic Regression
•   Random Forest
•   KNN
